text: Jose M. Hernandez (born February 9, 1940 in Bakersfield, California) is a former American and later Canadian football wide receiver who has played in the National Football League for the Washington Redskins and the Edmonton Eskimos in the Canadian Football league. ==Career== Hernandez played college football at the University of Arizona and was drafted in the second round of the 1962 NFL Draft. Hernandez was also selected in the fifth round of the 1962 AFL Draft by the Oakland Raiders."Arizona Daily Star", "Wildcat football team of '61 was led by a `Jackrabbit'" (September 15, 1994, Section: Sports)" Upon his return to the Edmonton Eskimos he switched to playing defensive back and was a two time all-star (1967 and 1970.) ==Personal life== Hernandez is of Mexican descent. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:American football wide receivers Category:American players of American football of Mexican descent Category:New Mexico Military Institute Broncos football players Category:Arizona Wildcats football players Category:Edmonton Eskimos players Category:Sportspeople from Bakersfield, California Category:Players of American football from California Category:Washington Redskins players
title: Joe Hernandez (American football)
